data.title: Pure deliciousness!
data.text: Amazingly creative menu, gorgeous dining room, impeccable service and delightful proprietor. True gem of a dining experience. Noodle bowls offer lots of choices and sushi options make you want to order everything on the menu. Minutes from the interstate make this a must stop anytime you are passing through or in Birmingham.

data.title: Asian Tapas, nearly perfect...
data.text: The idea for the restaurant is Asian inspired small plates. A great idea, and they also have great sushi. The food has vibrant and creative flavors using fresh classic asian ingredients like ginger. The only reason they aren't perfect is the atmosphere. If you're coming for any sort of quiet time to talk you're coming to the wrong place. It's always very loud with talking and music. Good music though!

data.title: Interesting Asian food in a cool neighborhood
data.text: I love the decor of this hip, new restaurant. Unique Asian fusion entrees and excellent cocktails. If you like Asian food, you will love this place.

data.title: Wonderful Surprise
data.text:
We had heard this restaurant was good but we weren't prepared for the experience.  It was a Thursday night at 7:30 and we waited about thirty minutes to be seated.  The place was alive with a well dressed crowd from late 20's through old age like me.  As you enter there is a long bar on your left and a long seating area to the right.  The decor in comfortable and very NY, LA, Miami.  Its a bit loud due to the hard surfaces but that adds to the bustle.  
Our waiter, I believe his name is Brent, was very attentive without being intrusive and he was very knowledgeable about the menu and the extensive Sake list.
 
We wanted to try the Momos but it was not available that night because a necessary ingredient had not arrived from Tibet, a testimony to the Chef's commitment to twisting traditional Tibetan recipes.  We were, however very impressed with the Spicy Tuna, Avacado, Cucumber with Aioli for a mere $8.00, the Tako octopus salad was stellar and the Seared Tuna with Ponzu and Jalapenos $13.00 was to die for. The presentation was beautiful.

Those of you who had read my other reviews will find me picky.  This was a perfect experience and I look forward to returning soon.

data.title: Worthy of a second review!
data.text: I have never reviewed any resturant a second time but there is always a first. I must say Bamboo on 2nd. in Birmingham AL. is off the charts. Maybe the best Pork Belly Ramen soup stateside and Sushi to die for. Start early as it can be very busy but worth the wait!! Over and above the fabulous food Bamboo has some of the best inherent ambiance I have been a part of!!!

data.title: Superb sushi
data.text: Great atmosphere, smooth chardonnay, amazing service  (thanks Sofia). The food spoke volumes. My son joined me later & loved it.

data.title: Excellent Sushi
data.text:
My husband and I had our date night at this restaurant and the food and service was excellent! They were pretty busy as it was a Saturday night. We almost left as we were very hungry and it was a 35 minute wait. So happy that we waited as it was worth the wait! I have eaten at many sushi restaurants in and around Birmingham and hands down this is the best one!
The only downside is that it is a very small restaurant and the seating is very close to others. We sat at the bar, and it was ent bad. I will definitely return!

data.title: Trendy
data.text: Walked in around 5:30 or 6 on a Saturday evening.  There was one table left.  The tables are pretty jammed close together, so not a great "date" arrangement. We moved to the bar.  The food was pretty good-and interesting, but mostly appetizer/small plates instead of dinner portions.  Good food to share.  We had pork belly skewers, egg roll, momos, and a wham Bham sushi roll.  All good. Most run about $10, sushi more like $15.  Food comes out quickly, within minutes of ordering.  Jackie Chan movie on one TV and a Godzilla flick on the other.  Trendy, like I said.  The crowd was almost all under 30.  Last time we came on a Friday night and it was more crowded but not so "young".   Parking is a challenge, be prepared to walk a few blocks.  If you park in a lot, be sure to pay and put your ticket in sight or you'll get a boot or towed.

data.title: Wow...yum!
data.text: We had some of the more interesting and delicious food here. The server was very helpful with suggestions since it was out first time. The KFC lollipops were incredible, and the Magic City Rolls are something I will order again for sure!

data.title: Terrible Experience
data.text: Maybe I don't want to be hip, but my experience here was bad. The food was good, don't get me wrong. But we were sat a very uncomfortable communal table too close for those we did know, let alone those we didn't. Then the waiter kept moving our drinks out of the middle of the table because we were supposed to share. We are adults, we know what we will share and what we won't. It just wasn't worth another visit.

data.title: Just go!
data.text: Don't wait, just go. Bamboo on 2nd is a great addition to the Birmingham restaurant scene and should not be missed. Honestly, some of the food actually melted in our mouths. Sushi was fresh and flavorful - lots of combinations to choose from. We started with two small plates and finished 3 rolls. Negatives? Drinks were very pricey. In fact, they had one drink on the menu that was $15!! I thought that I was in Vegas briefly......for Birmingham, I think that's a little high. Good selection of beers and wine though. Regardless, I highly recommend and we will be back!

data.title: Excellent experience.
data.text: Fantastic downtown location. Fantastic service. Fantastic food! Having been familiar with one of the owners who formerly worked at another local restaurant and offered great service, I was excited to check out this new place. I was not disappointed. Original menu and unique, fresh surroundings, plus delicious food make this a new favorite!

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Food is unbelievable! We were there when Ono Ice was there and had some fabulous drinks! Great atmosphere, but wish they had seating for more than 2 people. We had to wait for a while for a table because we had 4 in our group, but ended up eating at the bar which was awkward with 4 people.

data.title: Cool atmosphere and great food!
data.text: We enjoyed a Sapporo beer on draft and some sake.  I wasn't a big fan but they have an extensive list of sake based on your tastes.  The tofu noodle bowl I ate was fantastic!

data.title: Loved it
data.text: Great atmosphere , good service and delicious food . Their noodle soup was really good . I would definitely recommend it.

data.title: #40 Celebration
data.text: We celebrated a special birthday here and it was delicious. Shared many many small plates which enabled us to sample lots of tastes! Beer battered eggplant yum. Chicken and beef skewers yum. Edamame yum. Sushi yum. Dumplings yum. Shrimp yum. It was a very lovely experience in downtown Bham and happy to say downtown continues to rise and shine ✨

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Enjoyed everything about Bamboo.  Had Edamame and Fried Green Beans, Pork Belly and Garlic Shrimp skewers, and Wham Bam Bham and Abhi's Beer Battered and Diplomat rolls.  Everything was excellent especially the pork belly and the Abhi's roll.

data.title: So much fun and great food!
data.text: I had heard great things about this new restaurant and it lives up to the reputation.  They don't take reservations so the wait -  even on a Monday night -  was about an hour.  Order the fried green bean appetizer - delicious.  We shared a huge platter of some of the best sushi I've ever had.  Cannot wait to return!

data.title: Exceeded our Expectations.
data.text: From the moment I walked in and continuing through the whole dining experience, this restaurant was a marvelous experience. A perfect balance of casual and cool, Bamboo serves excellent food in an atmosphere that's alive without being crowded.

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: The food here is excellent! Appetizers, sushi, and noodle bowls. You really can't go wrong. I eat here every time I visit Birmingham.
